Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Help Us Improve Our Open Source Repositories!" (#9689) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We'd love to hear from those of you who participate often in our open source project and let us know how we're doing as maintainers.

Whether you've been involved for a while now or you're relatively new to open source, please let us know about your experience by [taking a survey that will take a couple minutes](https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/BMMSK9F).

Thank you kindly!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: api.nuget.org blocked by Checkpoint IPS" (#9674) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

Other

### Describe the bug

We find that api.nuget.org is blocked by Checkpoint IPS, is this normal?

### Repro Steps

1. open terminal and run "curl -vk https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
2. get below result
3. * Establish HTTP proxy tunnel to api.nuget.org:443
> CONNECT api.nuget.org:443 HTTP/1.1
> Host: api.nuget.org:443
> User-Agent: curl/7.61.1
> Proxy-Connection: Keep-Alive
>
< HTTP/1.1 504 Gateway Timeout
< Pragma: no-cache
< Cache-Control: no-store
< Connection: keep-alive
< Proxy-Connection: keep-alive
< Content-Type: text/html
< Content-Length: 199
<
* Received HTTP code 504 from proxy after CONNECT
* CONNECT phase completed!
* Closing connection 0
curl: (56) Received HTTP code 504 from proxy after CONNECT




### Expected Behavior

1. open terminal and run "curl -vk https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
2. should be get the content in index.json

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Bump Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages.Data from 3.2.3 to 3.2.9" (#9679) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Bumps [Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages.Data](https://github.com/aspnet/AspNetWebStack) from 3.2.3 to 3.2.9.
Release notes

Sourced from Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages.Data's releases.

3.2.9

What's Changed

  • Localized Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages.Data packages do not provide correct resources
  • Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Core 5.2.8 has System.Web.Http.dll with file version lower than the one in 5.2.7 nuget release

3.2.8

What's Changed

  • Correct discussion links in CONTRIBUTING.md by @​dougbu in aspnet/AspNetWebStack#228
  • !fixup! CONTRIBUTING.md typo by @​dougbu in aspnet/AspNetWebStack#229
  • Update ReflectedHttpActionDescriptor.cs by @​chinason in aspnet/AspNetWebStack#239
  • Replace link to outdated repo in README.md by @​cendern in aspnet/AspNetWebStack#244
  • Link Code of Conduct by @​terrajobst in aspnet/AspNetWebStack#277
  • Replace 'master' with 'main' by @​JunTaoLuo in aspnet/AspNetWebStack#295
  • Rebrand to v3.2.8 / v5.2.8 by @​dougbu in aspnet/AspNetWebStack#298
  • [releaes/3.2.8] Get builds working again by @​dougbu in aspnet/AspNetWebStack#302
  • Clean up doc comments for PushStreamContent by @​pranavkm in aspnet/AspNetWebStack#311
  • Configure max request line size limits to be the same as maxHeaderSize by @​pranavkm in aspnet/AspNetWebStack#312
  • Remove deprecated <licenseUrl /> element by @​dougbu in aspnet/AspNetWebStack#315

Issues resolved

  • HttpResponseMessage Serialisation still breaks in .NET Core 3.0
  • Increase HTTP header line size limit during deserialization of HttpRequestMessage
  • Crash when deserializing a HttpResponseMessage on .NET Core
  • Fix the LicenseUrl and IconURL metadata items for packages

New Contributors

  • @​chinason made their first contribution in aspnet/AspNetWebStack#239
  • @​cendern made their first contribution in aspnet/AspNetWebStack#244

Full Changelog: https://github.com/aspnet/AspNetWebStack/compare/v3.2.7...v3.2.8

3.2.7

Features

  • NuGet Package : Add repository metadata. (#190)
  • System.Net.Http.FormattingUtilities missed RFC 850 (#187)

Bugs Fixed

  • Correct typos in OKResult (#214)
  • ByteRangeStream does not limit CopyToAsync(...) range as it should (#206)
  • Whitespace (any uri escapable char) in virtual path root results in NoRouteFound in an WebApi/Owin setup (#203)
  • JsonMediaTypeFormatter doesn't work when Request is chunked (#197)
  • Release notes link in NuGet package is out-of-date (#178)
  • DefaultHttpBatchHandler creates innerRequest with scheme http even when outer batch request scheme is https (#173)
  • RadioButtonFor doesn't resolve isChecked properly when nested in EditorTemplate (#164)
  • Make exception handling policy configurable for CORS (#147)

3.2.6

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 2fa23f2 Merge tag 'v3.2.8' into 'main' (#320)
  • 4f5ebd6 Merge tag 'v3.2.8' into dougbu/merge/v3.2.8
  • 646f452 Merge tag 'v3.2.8' into 'main' (#319)
  • f7321b3 Update README now 3.2.8 is live (#318)
  • 005f94e Merge in 'release/3.2.8' changes
  • 362b7be Remove deprecated \<licenseUrl /> element (#315)
  • 20c076c Merge in 'release/3.2.8' changes
  • ef4296e Configure max request line size limits to be the same as maxHeaderSize (#312)
  • 664af54 Merge in 'release/3.2.8' changes
  • d1df0c8 Clean up doc comments for PushStreamContent (#311)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages.Data&package-manager=nuget&previous-version=3.2.3&new-version=3.2.9)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Update documentation for NU1011 error indicating how to allow floating versions with central package management" (#12919) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
As part of https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/5440 we'll be allowing users to enable floating versions with central package management (CPM).  We'll need to update the documentation for the NU1011 error to explain how to enable the functionality since it will remain off by default.  

https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/blob/main/docs/reference/errors-and-warnings/NU1011.md

Proposed wording:

### Solution
NuGet recommends not using floating versions with central package management and instead encourages users change the floating versions to a [non floating version range](https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/blob/main/docs/concepts/Package-Versioning.md#version-ranges).

If changing to non floating versions is not possible, users can enable the functionality by setting the MSBuild property `CentralPackageFloatingVersionsEnabled` to `true` in an individual project or a common import like [Directory.Build.props](https://learn.microsoft.com/visualstudio/msbuild/customize-by-directory#directorybuildprops-and-directorybuildtargets):

```xml
<PropertyGroup>
  <CentralPackageFloatingVersionsEnabled>true</CentralPackageFloatingVersionsEnabled>
</PropertyGroup>
```

***NOTE: The use of floating versions can introduce non-deterministic NuGet restores as described above and is not recommended.***

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Help Us Improve Our Open Source Repositories!" (#12917) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We'd love to hear from those of you who participate often in our open source project and let us know how we're doing as maintainers.

Whether you've been involved for a while now or you're relatively new to open source, please let us know about your experience by [taking a survey that will take a couple minutes](https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/BMMSK9F).

Thank you kindly!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget treats path starting with / as arguments on WSL" (#12912) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

6.7.0

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

I'm using Nuget.Commandline 6.7.0 package to run Nuget on Ubuntu 22 in WSL.
Looks like it treats any argument starting with / as an argument option, so a path starting with / does not work.
E.g.
nuget pack /home/my.nuspec # responds with error: Unknown argument /home/my.nuspec
But
cd /home
nuget pack my.nuspec # works fine

Converting all paths to be relative is a big pain

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bump NuGet runnable assemblies to net7.0" (#12908) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
This bumps a bunch of our runnable assemblies to net7.0. 
Some of these projects such as `nuget.command.xplat` and `nuget.build.tasks` need to depend on newer versions of msbuild assemblies which only tend to target newer .net versions. 
See for example: https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Build#dependencies-body-tab.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet Source Transformation (.pp) not working as expected" (#12857) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
---
**Issue moved from dotnet/msbuild#8322**
- Please respond to @Aragas.

---

_From @Aragas on Thursday, January 19, 2023 4:33:16 PM_

<!-- This is a template that helps us provide quicker feedback. Please use any relevant sections and delete anything you don't need. -->

### Issue Description
As I understand, MSBuild 17.5 might have broken the transformation.
The `obj` folder that should contain the transformed source code (`.cs.pp`) of a nuget package is empty - it doesn't contain the final `.cs` files where things like `$rootnamespace$` are resolved.
As an example, I have a NuGet Source Package (`BUTR.DependencyInjection` version 2.0.0.43) that stopped working.
The workarounds I saw while browsing source codes were basically "get rid of the .pp ending", since `.pp` was just used to hide the additional files. But how to fix it when it was used for the actual transformations?

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Create an empty C# project
2. Add `BUTR.DependencyInjection` version 2.0.0.43

## Expected Behavior
`.pp` files should be correctly transformed into `.cs` files


## Actual Behavior
`.pp` files are not correctly transformed into `.cs` files

### Versions & Configurations
VS2022
MSBuild version 17.4.1+9a89d02ff for .NET Framework
17.4.1.60106

VS2022 Preview
MSBuild version 17.5.0-preview-23053-01+ac0911a00 for .NET Framework
17.5.0.5301

VS2019
Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 16.11.2+f32259642 for .NET Framework
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

Happens in VS2019/VS2022/VS2022 Preview.
Happens on Rider too when MSBuild is used.

The computer I'm using is a fresh install. It does work still on my older one, ~~but it's I guess because I didn't upgrade yet, it's version is 17.4+9a89d02ff~~

EDIT:
The version of MSBuild seems to be the same for the working one and the broken one when using VS2022, the MSBuild versions of VS2019 is 16.
After verifying this, I have no idea what is causing this.
Also, to add to the confusion, when Rider is switched to use MSBuild, the same issue happens there too.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021" (#53) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The current NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021. If you validate that packages are repository signed by NuGet.org using a [NuGet client policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/consume-packages/installing-signed-packages), the [`NuGet.exe verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-verify) command, or the [`dotnet nuget verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-nuget-verify) command, you will need to take steps by March 15th, 2021 to avoid disruptions when installing packages from NuGet.org that are signed with the new certificate. 

If you are unsure if you will be impacted or want to see instructions to allow the new certificate, please see our blogpost on the matter: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/the-nuget-org-repository-signing-certificate-will-be-updated-as-soon-as-march-15th-2021/

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The Microsoft author-signing certificate will be updated as soon as August 14th, 2023" (#70) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The current Microsoft author-signing certificate will be updated as soon as August 14th, 2023.  If you validate that packages are author signed by Microsoft using a [NuGet client policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/installing-signed-packages) or the [`verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-verify) command, you will need to take steps to avoid disruptions when installing Microsoft packages signed with the new certificate.

If you are unsure if you will be impacted or want to see instructions to allow the new certificate, please see our blog post on the matter: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/microsoft-author-signing-certificate-update-2023/
